Orientation                      Undergraduate       Graduate       Doctoral                   Current Students QUICKLINKS     Parents  QUICKLINKS                     The New Undergraduate Experience            Welcome to the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development! NYU Steinhardt Undergraduate Orientation is comprised of several key components designed to welcome you to our vibrant community and allow you to get connected, to be involved, and to stay informed.    Orientation Programming for New Students    Online Orientation Portal All new students must review materials and complete quizzes in our Online Orientation Portal . Through this portal, you will:       Get to know your academic advisor, current students, and peers    Learn about our history, mission, and values    Understand your major and degree requirements    Create and register your first semester schedule    Discover services and activities to help you grow and develop    Share what you’ve learned with your family to keep them connected       Dean's Welcome and Academic Sessions This August 2015, join NYU Steinhardt Student Affairs and your academic departments for a special welcome breakfast with our Dean, and meet in person with your academic advisor and orientation leaders. Explore your new home in New York City. Participate in workshops, activities, and service-learning projects sponsored by the NYU Steinhardt and University community.    Monday, August 31, 2015 Skirball Center for the Performing Arts 566 LaGuardia Place 9am - 1pm    NYU Welcome Week / Spring at the Square At the beginning of each term, we host special events to celebrate your arrival on campus. This will be your first opportunity to meet in person with your academic advisor and orientation leaders. You will also have the opportunity to participate in other workshops, activities, and events sponsored by NYU, which are all designed to help you get started and connect you with new classmates who are also beginning their studies in one of the other seven undergraduate divisions at NYU. Learn more .    New Student Seminar (SAHS-UE 1) In this course you begin to explore your role as a student in this diverse and global academic community. New Student Seminar also introduces you to your program of study as an aspiring professional in your chosen field. The New Student Reading , a literary work that raises questions important to this process of exploration will be assigned this summer. Mid-semester, join us at our New Student Convocation, hosted by the Dean of NYU Steinhardt to discuss themes connected to our reading and your experiences as a new student. New Student Seminar is a required first semester course for new undergraduate students.    Questions? Call 212-998-5065 or email steinhardt.orientation@nyu.edu .    Communications with New Students    Fall 2015 new first-year and transfer students will hear from us in May 2015. For a glimpse of what to expect, take a look at the emails shared with new students in Summer 2014 below.    New Student Email 1 - New Undergraduate Experience    New Student Email 2 - Online Orientation & Social Media    New Student Email 3 - The Online Orientation Portal & Advisor Web Chats    New Student Email 4 - New Student Seminar: Theme & Reading    New Student Email 5 - A Special Note from Dean Patricia Carey    New Student Email 6 - 2014 Welcome Week Events    New Student Email 7 - Express Steinhardt! Showcase Your Talent    Parents & Families of New Students    Congratulations on your student's acceptance to the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development. We are thrilled that she or he has decided to join our family at NYU Steinhardt. As parents of incoming students, we realize that you have many questions. Please bookmark this page as it will be updated throughout the Summer as information is sent to your student.       Visit the Steinhardt Student Affairs blog .    Subscribe to the NYU Steinhardt Newsletter .    Take look at the NYU Steinhardt Parents & Families Portal .    Visit the NYU Parents website and sign up for the NYU Parent's E-Newsletter. Call or email the NYU Parent's Helpline at 212-998-4219 or parents@nyu.edu    Questions? Contact the NYU Steinhardt Office of Student Affairs at 212-998-5065 or steinhardt.orientation@nyu.edu .      Doctoral                   Current Students QUICKLINKS                     Orientation Leaders               2015 Orientation Leader Application Information    (Applications Due Monday, February 9 th by 4pm)    Orientation Leaders are responsible for engaging and leading new students in their departments throughout the New Undergraduate Experience. This includes our on-going Online Orientation over the summer, Deans Welcome and departmental sessions during NYU Welcome Week, and throughout the Fall 2015 semester in New Student Seminar and weekly office hours. Orientation Leader training occurs on-campus during the Spring 2015 semester, and the position is remote throughout the summer until Welcome Week.       Orientation Leaders assist in creating a welcoming climate for both incoming transfer students and new first-year students by sharing their own experiences at NYU, helping to facilitate the virtual advising and registration process, and serving as mentors to new students as they transition into NYU. Orientation Leaders are responsible for co-facilitating a section of New Student Seminar. Candidates for this position must be able to communicate with departmental advisors as well as articulate ALBERT registration procedures to new students. Orientation Leaders assist with Fall recruitment events on scheduled weekends.       Successful Orientation Leaders:       Understand our Online Orientation Portal/ALBERT and where to find information to refer students    Facilitate engagement with new students through social media    Answer questions related to student life on campus    Share personal experiences related to NYU    Provide 1:1 mentorship to new students in the Fall semester           Guidelines       You MUST be available for all required dates and be able to work remotely a minimum of 10 hours per week between May 4 th and August 21 st .    During the Fall semester you must be able to co-facilitate a section of New Student Seminar (class time discussed with department) and hold a minimum of 3 office hours per week. You will also represent your program at key Fall recruitment weekends (date TBA).    You may be employed outside of this role as long as you can commit to the training and all required dates and times.    You may register for summer classes as long as they do not conflict with required dates and times.    You are not eligible to apply if you have a graduation date of May 2015 or September 2015.    Demonstrated knowledge of key social network platforms (Facebook, Tumblr, Google Groups) is preferred.          Applying & Interviewing       New applicants are required to attend an information session. Dates are listed on the next page. If you are unable to attend an information session you must contact Justine Kelly-Fierro at justine@nyu.edu .    Online applications (http://steinhardt.nyu.edu/orientation/leaders) and supporting documents (unofficial transcript and resume) must be submitted by 4 pm on Monday, February 9 th , 2015. No exceptions. Applicants must be NYU Steinhardt undergraduate students.    One of your references MUST be your current academic advisor. You must contact them prior to providing their reference information.    Interviews will be held the week of February 23 rd – February 27 th . You will receive an e-mail regarding scheduling the week of February 17 th .    If you are late, need to cancel or reschedule your interview please call the office immediately. Missed interviews WILL NOT BE RESCHEDULED. You can reschedule IN ADVANCE by calling us at (212) 998-5065.    Interviews will run for approximately 20 minutes each and will be conducted by two staff members.    ü All students will be notified by email of the result of the interview process before Spring Break.            Required Commitments    You must be available:                       Commitment          Date & Time                Information Session    (choose 1)          Wed. January 28 th , 12:30pm or 2pm – Pless 2    Thurs. January 29 th , 12:30pm or 2pm – Pless 3    Mon. February 2 nd , 5pm – Pless 3    Wed. February 4 th , 12:30pm or 2pm – Pless 2    Thurs. February 5 th , 12:30pm or 2pm – Pless 2                Application Deadline          Mon. February 9 th , 4pm                Orientation Leader Interview          Mon. February 24 th – Fri. February 28 th (time TBA)                Orientation Leader Training          Fri. March 27 th , 5-7pm    Fri. April 3 rd , 5-7pm    Fri. April 10 th , 5-7pm    Fri. April 17 th , 5-7pm    Fri. April 24 th , 5-7pm    Fri. May 1 st , 5-7pm                Social Media Monitoring & Content Generation    (~10 hours weekly)          Mon. May 4 th – Fri. August 28 th                New Student Seminar Development Session          Thurs. August 27 th    Fri. August 28 th                   Welcome Week          Sat. August 29 th – Tues. September 1 st , time TBA    ~5-10 hour commitment                New Student Seminar          Weekly TBD in Fall 2015                Office Hours          3 hours weekly in Fall 2015                Departmental Meetings & Additional Trainings          TBD in Fall 2015                Fall Recruitment Events          TBD in Fall 2015                   DATES SUBJECT TO CHANGE    Benefits & Compensation       Participate in student leadership training & 1:1 student mentorship    Establish positive relationships with faculty, staff and peers within the program    Develop and articulate transferrable skills appropriate to your personal and professional goals    Enhance your communication and facilitation skills    Strengthen personal leadership identity    $2000 stipend; disbursed in 3 payments from July – December 2015 contingent on satisfactory completion of position responsibilities. State & Federal Tax withholdings apply.       APPLICATIONS ARE NOW CLOSED FOR 2015                    This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©        by New York University. 9 th by 4pm)    Orientation Leaders are responsible for engaging and leading new students in their departments throughout the New Undergraduate Experience. This includes our on-going Online Orientation over the summer, Deans Welcome and departmental sessions during NYU Welcome Week, and throughout the Fall 2015 semester in New Student Seminar and weekly office hours. Orientation Leader training occurs on-campus during the Spring 2015 semester, and the position is remote throughout the summer until Welcome Week.       Orientation Leaders assist in creating a welcoming climate for both incoming transfer students and new first-year students by sharing their own experiences at NYU, helping to facilitate the virtual advising and registration process, and serving as mentors to new students as they transition into NYU. Orientation Leaders are responsible for co-facilitating a section of New Student Seminar. Candidates for this position must be able to communicate with departmental advisors as well as articulate ALBERT registration procedures to new students. Orientation Leaders assist with Fall recruitment events on scheduled weekends.       Successful Orientation Leaders:       Understand our Online Orientation Portal/ALBERT and where to find information to refer students    Facilitate engagement with new students through social media    Answer questions related to student life on campus    Share personal experiences related to NYU    Provide 1:1 mentorship to new students in the Fall semester           Guidelines       You MUST be available for all required dates and be able to work remotely a minimum of 10 hours per week between May 4 th and August 21 st .    During the Fall semester you must be able to co-facilitate a section of New Student Seminar (class time discussed with department) and hold a minimum of 3 office hours per week. You will also represent your program at key Fall recruitment weekends (date TBA).    You may be employed outside of this role as long as you can commit to the training and all required dates and times.    You may register for summer classes as long as they do not conflict with required dates and times.    You are not eligible to apply if you have a graduation date of May 2015 or September 2015.    Demonstrated knowledge of key social network platforms (Facebook, Tumblr, Google Groups) is preferred.          Applying & Interviewing       New applicants are required to attend an information session. Dates are listed on the next page. If you are unable to attend an information session you must contact Justine Kelly-Fierro at justine@nyu.edu .    Online applications (http://steinhardt.nyu.edu/orientation/leaders) and supporting documents (unofficial transcript and resume) must be submitted by 4 pm on Monday, February 9 th , 2015. No exceptions. Applicants must be NYU Steinhardt undergraduate students.    One of your references MUST be your current academic advisor. You must contact them prior to providing their reference information.    Interviews will be held the week of February 23 rd – February 27 th . You will receive an e-mail regarding scheduling the week of February 17 th .    If you are late, need to cancel or reschedule your interview please call the office immediately. Missed interviews WILL NOT BE RESCHEDULED. You can reschedule IN ADVANCE by calling us at (212) 998-5065.    Interviews will run for approximately 20 minutes each and will be conducted by two staff members.    ü All students will be notified by email of the result of the interview process before Spring Break.      Doctoral                   Current Students QUICKLINKS                     Graduate Orientation            Welcome to the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development! NYU Steinhardt Graduate Orientation is comprised of several components designed to welcome you to our vibrant community and allow you to get connected, be involved, and stay informed.    Orientation Programming for New Students    After submitting your tuition deposit, you will receive an e-mail that includes information on your next steps as a new graduate student. All new students must review the material in our Graduate Orientation Portal . Through this portal you will:       Watch a video from your department's chair    Learn about your program's process for advisement and registration    Understand your major and degree requirements    Learn how to use the ALBERT registration system    Discover services and activities to help you grow and develop academically and professionally       International students will:       Review and take steps toward satisfying Steinhardt's faculty policy on English proficiency    Understand the requirements for registering for the appropriate number of credits    Register for the New Graduate International Student Seminar    Schedule their mandatory OGS check-in workshop (F1, J1 visa holders only)       New Graduate Student Welcome    At the beginning of each semester NYU Steinhardt hosts a welcome session to commemorate the arrival of new graduate students. Please join us to learn about policies and procedures at NYU Steinhardt that guide graduate study, find out about student resources in the school and university, and meet your colleagues. Stay tuned for more information. NYU Steinhardt Undergraduate Orientation is comprised of several key components designed to welcome you to our vibrant community and allow you to get connected, to be involved, and to stay informed.    Orientation Programming for New Students    Online Orientation Portal All new students must review materials and complete quizzes in our Online Orientation Portal . Through this portal, you will:       Get to know your academic advisor, current students, and peers    Learn about our history, mission, and values    Understand your major and degree requirements    Create and register your first semester schedule    Discover services and activities to help you grow and develop    Share what you’ve learned with your family to keep them connected       Dean's Welcome and Academic Sessions This August 2015, join NYU Steinhardt Student Affairs and your academic departments for a special welcome breakfast with our Dean, and meet in person with your academic advisor and orientation leaders. Explore your new home in New York City. Participate in workshops, activities, and service-learning projects sponsored by the NYU Steinhardt and University community.    Monday, August 31, 2015 Skirball Center for the Performing Arts 566 LaGuardia Place 9am - 1pm    NYU Welcome Week / Spring at the Square At the beginning of each term, we host special events to celebrate your arrival on campus. This will be your first opportunity to meet in person with your academic advisor and orientation leaders. You will also have the opportunity to participate in other workshops, activities, and events sponsored by NYU, which are all designed to help you get started and connect you with new classmates who are also beginning their studies in one of the other seven undergraduate divisions at NYU. Learn more .    New Student Seminar (SAHS-UE 1) In this course you begin to explore your role as a student in this diverse and global academic community. New Student Seminar also introduces you to your program of study as an aspiring professional in your chosen field. The New Student Reading , a literary work that raises questions important to this process of exploration will be assigned this summer. Mid-semester, join us at our New Student Convocation, hosted by the Dean of NYU Steinhardt to discuss themes connected to our reading and your experiences as a new student. New Student Seminar is a required first semester course for new undergraduate students.    Questions? Call 212-998-5065 or email steinhardt.orientation@nyu.edu .    Communications with New Students    Fall 2015 new first-year and transfer students will hear from us in May 2015. For a glimpse of what to expect, take a look at the emails shared with new students in Summer 2014 below.      Doctoral                   Current Students QUICKLINKS                     Orientation Leaders               2015 Orientation Leader Application Information    (Applications Due Monday, February 9 th by 4pm)    Orientation Leaders are responsible for engaging and leading new students in their departments throughout the New Undergraduate Experience. This includes our on-going Online Orientation over the summer, Deans Welcome and departmental sessions during NYU Welcome Week, and throughout the Fall 2015 semester in New Student Seminar and weekly office hours. Orientation Leader training occurs on-campus during the Spring 2015 semester, and the position is remote throughout the summer until Welcome Week.       Orientation Leaders assist in creating a welcoming climate for both incoming transfer students and new first-year students by sharing their own experiences at NYU, helping to facilitate the virtual advising and registration process, and serving as mentors to new students as they transition into NYU. Orientation Leaders are responsible for co-facilitating a section of New Student Seminar. Candidates for this position must be able to communicate with departmental advisors as well as articulate ALBERT registration procedures to new students. Orientation Leaders assist with Fall recruitment events on scheduled weekends.       Successful Orientation Leaders:       Understand our Online Orientation Portal/ALBERT and where to find information to refer students    Facilitate engagement with new students through social media    Answer questions related to student life on campus    Share personal experiences related to NYU    Provide 1:1 mentorship to new students in the Fall semester           Guidelines       You MUST be available for all required dates and be able to work remotely a minimum of 10 hours per week between May 4 th and August 21 st .    During the Fall semester you must be able to co-facilitate a section of New Student Seminar (class time discussed with department) and hold a minimum of 3 office hours per week. You will also represent your program at key Fall recruitment weekends (date TBA).    You may be employed outside of this role as long as you can commit to the training and all required dates and times.    You may register for summer classes as long as they do not conflict with required dates and times.    You are not eligible to apply if you have a graduation date of May 2015 or September 2015.    Demonstrated knowledge of key social network platforms (Facebook, Tumblr, Google Groups) is preferred.          Applying & Interviewing       New applicants are required to attend an information session. Dates are listed on the next page. If you are unable to attend an information session you must contact Justine Kelly-Fierro at justine@nyu.edu .    Online applications (http://steinhardt.nyu.edu/orientation/leaders) and supporting documents (unofficial transcript and resume) must be submitted by 4 pm on Monday, February 9 th , 2015. No exceptions. Applicants must be NYU Steinhardt undergraduate students.    One of your references MUST be your current academic advisor. You must contact them prior to providing their reference information.    Interviews will be held the week of February 23 rd – February 27 th . You will receive an e-mail regarding scheduling the week of February 17 th .    If you are late, need to cancel or reschedule your interview please call the office immediately. Missed interviews WILL NOT BE RESCHEDULED. You can reschedule IN ADVANCE by calling us at (212) 998-5065.    Interviews will run for approximately 20 minutes each and will be conducted by two staff members.    ü All students will be notified by email of the result of the interview process before Spring Break.          Undergraduate       Graduate       Doctoral                   Current Students QUICKLINKS     Parents  QUICKLINKS                     The New Undergraduate Experience            Welcome to the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development! NYU Steinhardt Undergraduate Orientation is comprised of several key components designed to welcome you to our vibrant community and allow you to get connected, to be involved, and to stay informed.    Orientation Programming for New Students    Online Orientation Portal All new students must review materials and complete quizzes in our Online Orientation Portal . Through this portal, you will:       Get to know your academic advisor, current students, and peers    Learn about our history, mission, and values    Understand your major and degree requirements    Create and register your first semester schedule    Discover services and activities to help you grow and develop    Share what you’ve learned with your family to keep them connected       Dean's Welcome and Academic Sessions This August 2015, join NYU Steinhardt Student Affairs and your academic departments for a special welcome breakfast with our Dean, and meet in person with your academic advisor and orientation leaders. Explore your new home in New York City. Participate in workshops, activities, and service-learning projects sponsored by the NYU Steinhardt and University community.    Monday, August 31, 2015 Skirball Center for the Performing Arts 566 LaGuardia Place 9am - 1pm    NYU Welcome Week / Spring at the Square At the beginning of each term, we host special events to celebrate your arrival on campus. This will be your first opportunity to meet in person with your academic advisor and orientation leaders. You will also have the opportunity to participate in other workshops, activities, and events sponsored by NYU, which are all designed to help you get started and connect you with new classmates who are also beginning their studies in one of the other seven undergraduate divisions at NYU. Learn more .    New Student Seminar (SAHS-UE 1) In this course you begin to explore your role as a student in this diverse and global academic community. New Student Seminar also introduces you to your program of study as an aspiring professional in your chosen field. The New Student Reading , a literary work that raises questions important to this process of exploration will be assigned this summer. Mid-semester, join us at our New Student Convocation, hosted by the Dean of NYU Steinhardt to discuss themes connected to our reading and your experiences as a new student. New Student Seminar is a required first semester course for new undergraduate students.    Questions? Call 212-998-5065 or email steinhardt.orientation@nyu.edu .    Communications with New Students    Fall 2015 new first-year and transfer students will hear from us in May 2015. For a glimpse of what to expect, take a look at the emails shared with new students in Summer 2014 below.      Doctoral                   Current Students QUICKLINKS                     Graduate Orientation            Welcome to the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development! NYU Steinhardt Graduate Orientation is comprised of several components designed to welcome you to our vibrant community and allow you to get connected, be involved, and stay informed.    Orientation Programming for New Students    After submitting your tuition deposit, you will receive an e-mail that includes information on your next steps as a new graduate student. All new students must review the material in our Graduate Orientation Portal . Through this portal you will:       Watch a video from your department's chair    Learn about your program's process for advisement and registration    Understand your major and degree requirements    Learn how to use the ALBERT registration system    Discover services and activities to help you grow and develop academically and professionally       International students will:       Review and take steps toward satisfying Steinhardt's faculty policy on English proficiency    Understand the requirements for registering for the appropriate number of credits    Register for the New Graduate International Student Seminar    Schedule their mandatory OGS check-in workshop (F1, J1 visa holders only)       New Graduate Student Welcome    At the beginning of each semester NYU Steinhardt hosts a welcome session to commemorate the arrival of new graduate students. Please join us to learn about policies and procedures at NYU Steinhardt that guide graduate study, find out about student resources in the school and university, and meet your colleagues. Stay tuned for more information.
